comment: No vanilla ...some cola in the front...some corn taste...spearmint...smooth finish
Faint pear and toasted marshmallow. Spicy start with a smooth finish.
Sweet smell on the nose, mild tasting at first with a little warmth.  Pick up Carmel and oak.  Out of the local flight I had, the best of the bunch

Corn is strong, but not overpowering.  Bourbon isn't normally my poison of choise but good stuff. 
      Sampled from Bender's stock (Batch 5/Bottle 73).
slightly sweet, chocolate in the middle, burn at the end, nice
Sweet, mild oak, rich lingering finish
notes of burnt sugar on the nose with a strong corn sweetness in the front with a little medicinal herbal note on the back end. Warm finish

We're prepping for our move to rural southwestern Wisconsin over the summer; it'll be a big shift, from life in a small apartment on the Northwest Side of Chicago to living on a micro farm outside of a small town. A good change in many ways, but a big one just the same. I decided to prep my palate by trying out the most well-regarded Wisconsin whiskey, produced within an hour or so of where we'll be living. The nose is immediate - this is a really fresh, crisp caramel covered apple sprinkled lightly with spice. Vanilla comes in next. The palate is remarkably smooth for only being a five year old bourbon; lush and buttery, with dulce de leche, apple, corn pops cereal, vanilla, a hint of cinnamon, and a dark chocolate dusted finish. If life in Wisconsin is as good as this bourbon, we're in for a great time!
Really like this one.  Great balance and flavor with just a little warmth.  Highly recommend.

Swirl the whiskey in the glass and check out the deep orangish amber. Nosing it brings an aroma of chocolate, toffee, caramel and a hint of sweet fruit. 
Lifting to the lips introduces custard, crème brulé, brioche, orange and toffee that spreads over the palate. Then, the custard swings back again to give a long, lasting finish.

This is the best Bourbon you've never heard of! Cheers!
got the one finished in cognac barrels. lots of custard flavors. banana on the nose.

The red heirloom corn is only grown by them and only used for their bourbon! The taste is sweet, rich corn which makes sense as 60% of the mash is corn. Even the aftertaste is a satisfying mellow corn.
Burns, a lot. Not a lot of flavor and lingers overlong. Not good.
Very well balanced. Great start and smooth finish. Price is perfect.

Love this one. I saw a segment about J Henry on PBS and it’s a very charming operation. My only wish is that it was a little bit cheaper. As it is now it will have to be an occasional treat. Definitely worth trying.
I can’t say go badgers but I can say go j. henry

Refined corn nose, mixed with, I wanna say apples, prairie wind, and a little caramel. I dont know how to sort out the rest except to say it's quite unique and pretty good. Definitely worth a buy, should you be passing through the fine state of WI.
Oak and a little green apple. Good flavor.
Bites on your first sip... then moved into such s wonderful flavor!
Batch #48 bottle 766: bananas on the nose, vodka on the palate

Not outstanding, but pretty enjoyable overall.  Has a slightly funky cherry, vanilla, and oat flavor that I seem to find in a number of craft distillery bourbons... not sure where that comes from, but it’s distinctive.
